suncertify.db
Class Data

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.Data
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBMain, DBPersistent<Contractor>
public class Data
extends Object
implements DBMain, DBPersistent<Contractor>

Data is an implementation of DBMain class.

Author:
Przemyslaw Bielicki
See Also:
DBMain, DBPersistent

                   String[] data)
            throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Modifies the fields of a record with given no. The new value for field n appears in data[n].

Specified by:
update in interface DBMain
Parameters:
recNo - int - the record no to be changed.
data - String[] - the updated data of the record to be stored into database.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If record with given no does not exist in database or record with given name and location already exists in database or system was unable to perform IO operation on database file.

find

public int[] find(String[] criteria)
           throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.

Specified by:
find in interface DBMain
Parameters:
criteria - String[] - the field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)
Returns:
int[] - the array of record numbers that match the specified criteria
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If no record matches specified criteria.
See Also:
DBMain.find(java.lang.String[])

create

public int create(String[] data)
           throws DuplicateKeyException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry). Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record.

Specified by:
create in interface DBMain
Parameters:
data - String[] - the data of the new record to be inserted into database.
Returns:
int - the record number of the new record.
Throws:
DuplicateKeyException - If record with given name and location already exists in database or system was unable to perform IO operation on database file.
See Also:
DBMain.create(java.lang.String[])

lock

public void lock(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Locks a record with given no so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. If the specified record is already locked, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Specified by:
lock in interface DBMain
Parameters:
recNo - int - the no of the record to be locked.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If record with given no does not exist in database.
See Also:
DBMain.lock(int)

            throws RecordNotFoundException

Specified by:
unlock in interface DBMain
Parameters:
recNo - int - the no of the record to be unlocked.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If record with given no does not exist in database.
See Also:

                 throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Determines if a record with given no is currenly locked.

Specified by:
isLocked in interface DBMain
Parameters:

Returns:
boolean - true if the record is locked, false otherwise.
